q: Indianapolis Star, Mike Pence has circulated a letter to supporters announcing the decision." "In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana," wrote Mike Pence . We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012. There are indications he may instead run for governor of Indiana. Well, the nation's loss is Indiana's gain. Mike Pence was one of the few potential candidates worth seriously considering, so

effort to speed up the decision-making within the company. Eric Schmidt has also drafted a plan to sell some of the stock he holds in the company. The news surfaced in a regulatory filing last week. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. Eric Schmidt holds 9.2 million shares of Google stock and has 9.6% of the company's voting power according to Reuters. He plans to sell 534,000 shares of Class A common stock--

a fictitious substance called "red mercury" that, according to local lore, can be found in the throats of ancient mummies. Some people think it has magical powers and can be used to summon spirits.
